title: The Golden Man (collection)
text:
The Golden Man is a collection of <a href="science%20fiction">science fiction</a> stories by American writer <a href="Philip%20K.%20Dick">Philip K. Dick</a>. It was first published by <a href="Berkley%20Books">Berkley Books</a> in 1980. The stories had originally appeared in the magazines "<a href="if%20%28magazine%29">If</a>", "<a href="Galaxy%20Science%20Fiction">Galaxy Science Fiction</a>", "<a href="Beyond%20Fantasy%20Fiction">Beyond Fantasy Fiction</a>", "Worlds of Tomorrow", "Science Fiction Stories", "<a href="Orbit%20Science%20Fiction">Orbit Science Fiction</a>", "Future", "<a href="Amazing%20Stories">Amazing Stories</a>" and "<a href="Fantasy%20and%20Science%20Fiction">Fantasy and Science Fiction</a>"
Reception.
<a href="Thomas%20M.%20Disch">Thomas M. Disch</a> reported that the collection included a wide range of work, from some of Dick's best to outright "turkeys", concluding "Dick is of that stature where even his failures merit publication."
